title: Keyless Ignition and Immobiliser Disconnect/Connect and Pin Numbering

body.body: Keyless Ignition and Immobiliser Disconnect/Connect and Pin Numbering
Disconnection of the Keyless Ignition and Immobiliser Connector
Never pull directly on the wires when disconnecting an electrical connector.
If you pull on the wires, the connector or the wires can become damaged.
Notice - General - Never disconnect ECM with ignition ON
Never disconnect an ECM when the ignition switch is in the ON position.
Disconnecting an ECM with the ignition set to ON can cause multiple fault codes to be logged in the ECM memory.
Always disconnect the battery, negative (black) lead first, before you disconnect an ECM.
Turn the ignition to the OFF position and wait at least 1 minute for the engine ECM to complete its power down sequence.
Disconnect the keyless ECM electrical connector from the main harness.
Reconnection of the Keyless Ignition and Immobiliser Connector
Damage to the connector pins may result if an attempt to fit the connectors incorrectly is made.
If the lever is not fully over to the rear position, it is possible that the connector may not fully engage into its socket.
Connect the keyless ECM connector to the main harness.
Keyless Ignition and Immobiliser Connector Pin Numbering
Keyless Ignition and Immobiliser ECM PB1; PJ1; PJZ; PM1; PR1; PRB; PRC; PS1; PSB; PSC; PX1; PXB; PXC; PY1; PYB; PYC
The illustration below shows the pin numbering system used in the Pinpoint Tests - Keyless Ignition and Immobiliser ECM.
Keyless Ignition and Immobiliser ECM Connector has 16 pins
As viewed on the mating face with the ECM (as per the illustration), pins are numbered from left to right with number one in the top right corner.

metadata.ModelsTaxonomyLink: PYB; PXB; PSB; PRB; PJZ; PYC; PXC; PSC; PRC; PY1; PX1; PS1; PR1; PM1; PJ1; PB1
